Main Topic: Essential Matters for Homeowners to Provide to the Builder

| Subtopics | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Proof of Ownership | Written proof that the owner owns or is otherwise entitled to build on the site |
| Site Details | Written details of any encumbrances, covenants, easements, and caveats affecting the site |
| Security Account | Written evidence that the security account has been established and the amount required to be paid into the security account is held in clear funds |
| Finance | Written advice from the lending body that the amount of finance, when added to the owner's own available funds, is sufficient to pay the contract price, and the building works may commence |
| Development Consent | Written evidence of development consent for the building works if the owner is named in Item 11 of Schedule 1 |
| Building Approvals | Written proof that the owner has obtained any building approvals and has satisfied any conditions imposed by a statutory or other authority where required prior to commencement of work |
| Principal Certifying Authority | Written proof that the owner has appointed the principal certifying authority and has paid any costs associated with such appointment |
| Statutory Obligations | Written proof that all of the owner's other statutory obligations that are listed in Item 9 of Schedule 1 have been satisfied |
| Consequences of Failure to Provide Essential Matters | The builder may end the contract if the owner fails to satisfy all of the essential matters within the initial period. If the builder ends the contract, the owner must pay to the builder the price of the services provided and works carried out to the date that the contract is ended, including the builder's margin applied to the costs incurred by the builder which costs include the cost of materials on site or already ordered from suppliers that are non-returnable |
